mods.abstract: Pharaoh smites an enemy, Temple of Rameses III (New Kingdom - Dynasty XX) at Medinet Habu, West Thebes; wall relief of Rameses III wearing the nemes crown and kilt as he grasps a crouching enemy by the hair and stabs him in the side eith a long spear, rows of hieroglyphs, cartouches indentifying Rameses III, and other Egyptian motifs (above); large fractured statue (left background); "otaeB .A" in white; "1045 Medinet-Habu Les prisonniers de Ramses" in pencil on back of print.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

subject.topic: Temple of Ramses III (Medinet Habu Site, Egypt)

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
